H0.text: The separate tanks are the control for this experiment, because they keep each of the five fish isolated while providing the same amount of food each day and maintaining the same temperature, allowing the effect of the 24‑hour artificial light exposure to be compared with the 22‑hour light condition.

H1.text: The amount of food is the control for the experiment in which a researcher places five fish in separate tanks, gives them the same amount of food each day, maintains a constant temperature, exposes one fish to 24 hours of artificial light daily, and subjects the other four fish to 22 hours of light followed by 2 hours of darkness each day.

H2.text: The fish deprived of light is the control for the experiment in which a researcher places five fish in separate tanks, feeds them the same amount of food each day, keeps the temperature the same, exposes one fish to artificial light for 24 hours each day, and subjects the remaining fish to 22 hours of light followed by 2 hours of darkness each day.

H3.text: The fish exposed to light for 24 hours is the control for the experiment in which a researcher places five fish in separate tanks, gives them the same amount of food each day, keeps the temperature the same, one fish receives artificial light for 24 hours daily while the others receive light for 22 hours followed by 2 hours of darkness each day.
